title: 100 All-Time Greatest Comics (3rd Ed)(gnv64)
description:
100 All-Time Greatest Comics (3rd Ed)
By SciFiNow (bookazine)
Imagine Publishing Ltd | 2016 | ISBN 9781785463235 | 180 pages | True PDF | 64.2 mb

Welcome to 100 All-Time Greatest Comics. 
This book aims to take you through the best of the best  when it comes to the world of the graphic novel. The  industry has been thrust into the limelight in recent  years, but is much more than simply superheroes in  favourites and perhaps discover something new.  Along the way you will be treated to some brilliantly  informative interviews with the creators including  an exclusive chat with writer Mark Millar about his  contribution to comics, a complete guide to all things  Tank Girl, a celebration of John Constantine and  Hellblazer and we explore how Captain America has  stood the test of time. Enjoy the book!

CONTENTS
010 ALAN MOoRE
The comic wizard on when he knew he had something revolutionary
022 Breaking into Comics
The creator of Phonogram, Kieron Gillen, takes us through his journey
046 Superman redrawn
John Romita Jr refl ects on his fi rst year drawing the superhero
052 Millar?s war
Millar talks about creating the bestselling comic of the last decade
068 History lessons
Roy Thomas talks about shaping the future of Marvel
078 Home of the Brave
Discover why Captain America has outlasted his patriotic peers
088 The art of Alex Ross
Check out the gallery of one of the worldâ€™s best comic book artists
102  Hellblazer
A complete guide to the Alan Moore-created series
112  Steve Niles
The 30 Days creator talks about the rebirth of horror in comics
130  Mike Mignola
The creator of Hellboy talks about the comic and Del Toroâ€™s fi lm
140   Grant Morrison
The Scottish legend talks about his involvement with the Dark Knight
154   The Father of Dredd
Creator John Wagner gives his views on Alex Garlandâ€™s Dredd
